Package org.parosproxy.paros.network

Class HttpBody

java.lang.Object
org.parosproxy.paros.network.HttpBody
Direct Known Subclasses:
HttpRequestBody, HttpResponseBody
public abstract class HttpBody extends Object
Abstract a HTTP body in request or response messages.
Since:
1.0.0

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final String
    DEFAULT_CHARSET
    The name of the default charset (ISO-8859-1) used for String related operations, for example, HttpBody(String), append(String), setBody(String), or toString().
    static final int
    LIMIT_INITIAL_CAPACITY
    The limit for the initial capacity, prevents allocating a bigger array when the Content-Length is wrong.

  • Constructor Summary

    Description

    Constructs a HttpBody with the given contents.
    HttpBody(int capacity)
    Constructs a HttpBody with the given initial capacity.

    Constructs a HttpBody with the given contents, using default charset for String related operations.

  • Field Details

    • DEFAULT_CHARSET

      public static final String DEFAULT_CHARSET
      The name of the default charset (ISO-8859-1) used for String related operations, for example, HttpBody(String), append(String), setBody(String), or toString().
      See Also:
      • setCharset(String)

    • LIMIT_INITIAL_CAPACITY

      public static final int LIMIT_INITIAL_CAPACITY
      The limit for the initial capacity, prevents allocating a bigger array when the Content-Length is wrong.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • HttpBody

      public HttpBody()
      Constructs a HttpBody with no contents (that is, zero length).

    • HttpBody

      public HttpBody(int capacity)
      Constructs a HttpBody with the given initial capacity.

      The initial capacity is limited to 128000 to prevent allocating big arrays.

      Parameters:
      capacity - the initial capacity

    • HttpBody

      public HttpBody(byte[] contents)
      Constructs a HttpBody with the given contents.

      If the given contents are null the HttpBody will have no content.

      Parameters:
      contents - the contents of the body, might be null
      Since:
      2.5.0

    • HttpBody

      public HttpBody(String contents)
      Constructs a HttpBody with the given contents, using default charset for String related operations.

      If the given contents are null the HttpBody will have no content.

      Note: If the contents are not representable with the default charset it might lead to data loss.

      Parameters:
      contents - the contents of the body, might be null
      See Also:
      • DEFAULT_CHARSET
      • HttpBody(byte[])

  • Method Details

    • setBody

      public void setBody(byte[] contents)
      Sets the given contents as the body.

      If the contents are null the call to this method has no effect.

      Parameters:
      contents - the new contents of the body, might be null

    • setBody

      public void setBody(String contents)
      Sets the given contents as the body, using the current charset.

      The given contents are encoded with the content encodings set, if any.

      If the contents are null the call to this method has no effect.

      Note: Setting the contents with incorrect charset might lead to data loss.

      Parameters:
      contents - the new contents of the body, might be null
      See Also:
      • setCharset(String)
      • getContentEncodings()

    • encode

      protected byte[] encode(byte[] data)

    • determineCharset

      protected Charset determineCharset(String contents)
      Determines the Charset of the given contents, that are being set to the body.

      An attempt to prevent data loss when new contents are set without a Charset.

      By default returns null.

      Parameters:
      contents - the contents being set to the body
      Returns:
      the Charset, or null if not known.
      Since:
      2.6.0

    • setDetermineCharset

      public void setDetermineCharset(boolean determine)
      Sets whether or not the Charset of the response should be determined, when no Charset is set.

      An attempt to prevent data loss when new contents are set without a Charset.

      Parameters:
      determine - true if the Charset should be determined, false otherwise.
      Since:
      2.6.0
      See Also:
      • isDetermineCharset()
      • setCharset(String)

    • isDetermineCharset

      public boolean isDetermineCharset()
      Tells whether or not the Charset of the response should be determined, when no Charset is set.

      An attempt to prevent data loss when new contents are set without a Charset.

      By default returns true.

      Returns:
      true if the Charset should be determined, false otherwise.
      Since:
      2.6.0
      See Also:
      • setDetermineCharset(boolean)
      • setCharset(String)

    • append

      public void append(byte[] contents, int length)
      Appends the given contents to the body, up to a certain length.

      If the contents are null or the length negative or zero, the call to this method has no effect.

      Parameters:
      contents - the contents to append, might be null
      length - the length of contents to append

    • append

      public void append(byte[] contents)
      Appends the given contents to the body.

      If the contents are null the call to this method has no effect.

      Parameters:
      contents - the contents to append, might be null

    • append

      public void append(String contents)
      Appends the given contents to the body, using the current charset.

      The given contents are encoded with the content encodings set, if any.

      If the contents are null the call to this method has no effect.

      Note: Setting the contents with incorrect charset might lead to data loss.

      Parameters:
      contents - the contents to append, might be null
      See Also:
      • setCharset(String)
      • getContentEncodings()

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Gets the String representation of the body, using the current charset.

      The representation is returned decoded, using the content encodings set, if any.

      The String representation contains only the contents set so far, that is, increasing the length of the body manually (with HttpBody(int) or setLength(int)) does not affect the string representation.

      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      the String representation of the body
      See Also:
      • getCharset()
      • getContentEncodings()

    • createString

      protected String createString(Charset charset)
      Returns the String representation of the body.

      Called when the cached string representation is no longer up-to-date.

      Parameters:
      charset - the current Charset set, null if none
      Returns:
      the String representation of the body
      Since:
      2.5.0
      See Also:
      • getBytes()

    • decode

      protected byte[] decode()
      Gets the body decoded, if any content encodings are applied.
      Returns:
      the body decoded.
      See Also:
      • getContentEncodings()

    • getPos

      protected final int getPos()
      Gets the actual (end) position of the contents in the byte array (different if the array was expanded, either by setting the initial capacity or its length). Should be used when creating the string representation of the body to only return the actual contents, set so far.
      Returns:
      the end position of the contents in the byte array
      Since:
      2.5.0
      See Also:
      • getBytes()
      • createString(Charset)

    • getBytes

      public byte[] getBytes()
      Gets the contents of the body as an array of bytes.

      The returned array of bytes mustn't be modified. Is returned a reference instead of a copy to avoid more memory allocations.

      Returns:
      a reference to the content of this body as byte[].
      Since:
      1.4.0

    • getContent

      public byte[] getContent()
      Gets the content of the body as bytes, without any encodings applied (if any).

      The returned array of bytes mustn't be modified. Is returned a reference instead of a copy to avoid more memory allocations.

      Returns:
      the content of the body.
      Since:
      2.10.0
      See Also:
      • getContentEncodings()
      • hasContentEncodingErrors()
      • toString()

    • hasContentEncodingErrors

      public boolean hasContentEncodingErrors()
      Tells whether or not the content encodings set to the body have errors (e.g. content malformed).
      Returns:
      true if there are errors while using the content encodings, false otherwise.
      Since:
      2.10.0
      See Also:
      • getContent()

    • setContent

      public void setContent(byte[] content)
      Sets the content of the body as bytes, applying any content encodings of the body, if any.
      Parameters:
      content - the content of the body.
      Since:
      2.10.0
      See Also:
      • getContentEncodings()

    • length

      public int length()
      Gets the current length of the body.
      Returns:
      the current length of the body.

    • setLength

      public void setLength(int length)
      Sets the current length of the body. If the current content is longer, the excessive data will be truncated.
      Parameters:
      length - the new length to set.

    • getCharset

      public String getCharset()
      Gets the name of the charset used for String related operations.

      If no charset was set it returns the default.

      Returns:
      the name of the charset, never null
      See Also:
      • setCharset(String)
      • DEFAULT_CHARSET

    • setCharset

      public void setCharset(String charsetName)
      Sets the charset used for String related operations, for example, append(String), setBody(String), or toString().

      The charset is reset if null or empty (that is, it will use default charset or the charset determined internally by HttpBody implementations). The charset is ignored if not valid (either the name is not valid or is unsupported).

      Parameters:
      charsetName - the name of the charset to set
      See Also:
      • getCharset()
      • DEFAULT_CHARSET

    • setContentEncodings

      public void setContentEncodings(List<HttpEncoding> encodings)
      Sets the content encodings of the body.
      Parameters:
      encodings - the encodings
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the given list or any of the encodings contained in the list are null.
      Since:
      2.10.0

    • getContentEncodings

      public List<HttpEncoding> getContentEncodings()
      Gets the content encodings of the body.
      Returns:
      the encodings, never null.
      Since:
      2.10.0
